text: Note: the line self.weight = 0.1 ... was changed and I'm not sure how or when but in order to get Loss:  1.0986104 you need to change it to weight = 0.01 * .... I spent a while trying to figure out why my values weren't exactly the same LOL

author: @sunOOconuresOOrock
text: Excellent series thank you for the work! Taking notes I found at 13:40 there is an issue with the parenthesis not to be a stickler but just so others notice and correct in their notes. The black background example of handling a Onehot-encoded targetvalues_true passed into the loss function has one too many ')'. Specifically the line correct_confidences = np.sum(y_pred_clipped*y_true), axis=1)   -- the ) following y_true should not be there, and it's corrected in the actual python file example that comes right after this example scene. So not a big deal just thought I'd throw it out there and say thanks for making the series!

If you are following along the series, the output at 15:14 won't match. Just change the weight multiplier, inside the Layer_Dense to 0.01.  Thanks for doing this series, the visuals and the explanations are superb!
